channel.title: Cor.test on Statistical and R blog
channel.description: Recent content in Cor.test on Statistical and R blog

item.title: Start with the data
item.description: The distribution of each variable The multi-test of correlations After verifying that there is no one missprint in the data and before starting the true statistical analysis, I check the distribution of data and relationships between factors. For this blog article, I use data of air quality available in R. The distribution of each variable To see distribution, I use a ggplot. library(tidyverse) D<-airquality # First time transform data of tidy ones D_tidy<-D %>% tidyr::gather(VAR, value, -Month, -Day) %>% mutate(Time = Month*30.
